intro: Sisymbrium subspinescens, commonly known as the spiny mustard, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its narrow, sparsely hairy leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Sisymbrium subspinescens is often found in dry, disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
